__e: I can forgive you for not knowing that her father was the President.
But I know I'd never forgive myself if I don't give us a second chance.
I know it's not my place, and please forgive me for talking out of turn, sir, but this is getting beyond now.
Well, we might have a shot at it... if you can forgive yourself for what you did.
I don't think that I could ever forgive her for what she did.
I know there's no way I can make up for what happened.
I don't quite know how to apologize for something like this, but...
I know you want to make up for the things you've done... believe me, we all do... but we need to think of the big picture... 25 people instead of 500.
I know I should be better than this, but I don't think I can forgive him for that.
There is nothing to forgive, my son.
- And I don't know if I could ever forgive my son for all the things he said to me.
Well, her ability to forgive my brother after everything he's done to destroy this family strikes me as a little strange to say the least.
And I know I need to forgive her, but I can't.
While I am not prepared to say that I forgive him, I most certainly do understand why he did what he did.
Is that you want to forgive me, you just need a little bit more time.
Whatever happened to "forgive and forget," right?
You know, my parents raised us to forgive and forget.
We both know that Dad is not the kind to forgive and forget.
So perhaps you should leave now. I'll be fine.
I need more time, Michael, to see if I can forgive you and get past this.
She can't forgive, that is the only edge any of you ever have had over her and now you don't even have that.
I can't forgive your dad for not telling us the truth about Mom, but if he really did make her happy, even for a little while, then without him, we wouldn't have you.
Even if he doesn't, you got to forgive yourself.
- No. Don't you know the best time to forgive somebody for a lot of horrible things?
